page.title: 02Principal Features
page.content: The principal features are as follows 1. The Yacht Basin. An area of water where the canal terminates which is used for leisure pursuits such as dinghy sailing,pleasure trips and where people live on boats for most of the year. 2. The Canal. A junction of the Lancaster canal which is used wholly for leisure i.e.cruising; house boats in summer;and fishing. The section in the block has four locks and a weir. 3. Thurnham Hall. A small stately home dating from the 13th century which is open to the public between Easter and the end of October. It is owned today by the Crabtree family.
